description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), pursuant to planning permission reference: 172722HH dated 07.08.2017 for 'Alteration of roof to increase ridge height; side roof dormer extension to northern elevation; front dormer window roof extension; and installation of two rooflights to side roofslope on southern elevation.'  Minor Material Amendment sought to raise ridge height; alter rooflight to side roofslope on southern elevation; installation of Juliet balcony (to rear roofslope); conversion of store/garage to habitable space and installation of rooflight to side extension roofslope.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of Planning Permission 172722HH dated 07.08.2017
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings: Proposed Elevations drawing no.PR-PL-G200-E-AL Rev03 and Proposed Floor Plans drawing no.PR-PL-G200-P-00 Rev03
REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with approved plans and as per planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 7.4 of the Adopted Ealing Development Plan Document 2013, Publication London Plan 2021 policy D2 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places

| The roof lights hereby approved shall not protrude more than 150 millimetres beyond the plane of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the surroundings and the host building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management  DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2 (f) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the development hereby permitted being first occupied, the window proposed to be located on the side elevation of the development shall be glazed with obscured glass up to 1.7m height, and non-opening below 1.7m height. Obscure glazing and non-opening components of these windows shall be maintained for the life of the development unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in  accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).
